definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
see 忍氣吞聲|忍气吞声[ren3 qi4 tun1 sheng1]
to harbor a grudge with deep-seated hatred (idiom)

sentences.english: If swallow, allowing the other side's humiliation, then the prestige of the country?
sentences.chinese: 如果忍氣吞聲，聽任對方的羞辱，那麼國威何在？
我要逆來順受，忍氣吞聲強作歡笑。

sentences.english: He often gulps down a sob .
sentences.chinese: 他經常忍氣吞聲地生活。

sentences.english: Lin Zijun in order not to expose the identity of it.
sentences.chinese: 林子君爲了不暴露身份，忍氣吞聲。

sentences.english: As things stood, what else could he do but swallow the insult?
sentences.chinese: 照當時情況，他除了忍氣吞聲又能怎麼辦呢？

sentences.english: For saving face Mary had to choke down the manager's insult.
sentences.chinese: 爲了顧全面子，瑪麗對於經理的侮辱只好忍氣吞聲。

sentences.english: What else could he do other than swallow an insult under the then condition.
sentences.chinese: 照當時情況，他除了忍氣吞聲又能怎麼辦呢？

sentences.english: After having submitted to humiliation for many years, Tom finally had it out with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 忍氣吞聲了多年後，湯姆最終和他的老闆攤牌了。

sentences.english: Many employees have to eat the crow when reproached by their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 當被老闆指責時，很多僱員都得忍氣吞聲，承認錯誤。

sentences.english: He gulped down sobs at the news.
sentences.chinese: 他一聽到這個消息就吞聲飲泣。

sentences.english: To take such abuse lying down would only encourage more of it.
sentences.chinese: 對這種歪風忍氣吞聲，只會鼓勵更多的歪風。
